intro: Virga stricta, commonly known as the rigid virga, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often with a slightly hairy surface. Virga stricta is often found in woodland areas and is adapted to thrive in regions with moderate to high rainfall.
